AvProblem.comment: possible at any time of day or night

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. Gliding snow remains the main problem, and has receded. Isolated naturally triggered glide-snow avalanches cannot be ruled out on steep stopes which have not yet discharged. Isolated loose-snow slides in steep rough and rocky terrain are possible. Triggering a slab avalanche is only possible in high alpine terrain by large additional loading.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Fresh snowdrifts have settled well, bonding of fresh snow to old snowpack is adequate until above 2500 m. The snow base is thoroughly moist up to high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: On Thursday, rainfall will taper off, some sunshine, elsewhere compact clouds predominate. On the southern flank of the Alps sunny with small convective cloud build-up in afternoon. Strong NW winds til midday, then sleackening off and shifting to westerly. At 2000 m: +6 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Cloudy in the morning, rainfall in the Northern Alps. As of midday, sunshine will slowly take over, the W/NW winds will be light-to-moderate, strong on the eastern rim of the Alps. At 2000 m: 4-9 degrees. Wet-snow problem will increase. On Saturday, lots of sunshine, very mild, daytime cycle of avalanche danger. Terminate backcountry tours early in the day.
